title: Ticket #2688: condor_q: bad error message if supplied constraint cannot be parsed
description:
When condor_q is given a bad constraint, the error message sucks. Here is an example. Note that I am using a single = sign, which causes the constraint to not parse correctly.

[kronenfe@submit-2 pytest]$ condor_q -const 'foo=bar'

-- Failed to fetch ads from: <128.104.100.29:9370> : submit-2.batlab.org

That error message is non-intuitive.
remarks:
2011-Dec-05 12:26:53 by gthain:
fixed. condor_q -const foo=bar now says: 

/scratch/gthain/CONDOR_SRC/release_dir/bin/condor_q -const 'foo=bar'

-- Parse error in constraint expression "foo=bar"
check_ins:
2011-Dec-05 13:13   Check-in [28576]: Fix warning in last commit #2688 (By Greg Thain )
2011-Dec-05 12:28   Check-in [28571]: Add better error message for unparseable condor_q constraints #2688 condor_q -const foo=bar now errors: -- Parse error in constraint expression "foo=bar" (By Greg Thain )
creator: kronenfe
